intro: Lavatera mauritanica var. davaei, commonly known as the Moroccan hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to North Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. It has hairy stems and broad, lobed leaves that help reduce water loss. The flowers bloom in summer and are often used in traditional medicine and ornamental gardening.
